com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification

Class DefaultNotifySupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification.DefaultNotifySupport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INotifySupport, ISelectableNotifySupport

    public class DefaultNotifySupport
extends Object
implements INotifySupport, ISelectableNotifySupport
    Event source support which uses an optional INotifier object to allow for different notification methods and, therefore, different types of selectableListeners.

    If no INotifier is specified, the selectableListeners are all assumed to be ICatalysEventListeners and the events all CatalysEventObjects.

    This class is thread safe. Per default only one thread at a time will be allowed to execute fireNotify() so listeners don't need to worry about multi-threading issues. However, this behaviour can be changed at construction time. In this case listeners must be able to deal with concurrent calls.

        public DefaultNotifySupport(String name)
        Constructor which creates an instance without an INotifier. Equivalent to DefaultNotifySupport(name, true).
        Parameters:

      • DefaultNotifySupport

        public DefaultNotifySupport(String name,
                            boolean synchronizeNotifications)
        Constructor which creates an instance without an INotifier. Equivalent to DefaultNotifySupport(name, null, synchronizeNotifications).
        Parameters:
        name - used in logging and exceptions to identify this instance
        synchronizeNotifications - if true only one thread at a time will be allowed to execute fireNotify(). If false concurrent calls are possible, in this case it is up to the listeners to implement thread safety.

      • DefaultNotifySupport

        public DefaultNotifySupport(String name,
                            INotifier notifier)
        Constructor to create an instance with an INotifier. Same as DefaultNotifySupport(name, notifier, true).
        Parameters:
        name - used in logging and exceptions to identify this instance
        notifier - will be set on listeners of type IListenerWrapper when they are added to this instance

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(EventListener listener)
        Register given listener. Duplicates are ignored, i.e. not added.

        Additionally, if listener is a IListenerWrapper its INotifier will be set and the wrapper will be IListenerWrapper.start()ed.

        If the listener throws and exception when it is notified, it will be automatically removed.

        Specified by:
        addListener in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener

      • addListener

        public void addListener(EventListener listener,
                        boolean removeOnException)
        Register given listener. Duplicates are ignored, i.e. not added.

        Additionally, if listener is a IListenerWrapper its INotifier will be set and the wrapper will be IListenerWrapper.start()ed.

        If the listener throws and exception when it is notified, it will be automatically removed if removeOnException is true.

        Specified by:
        addListener in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        removeOnException - whether to remove the listener after it throws an exception

      • removeAllListeners

        public void removeAllListeners()
        Removes all listeners.

        Dispose is called on any selectableListeners that are IListenerWrappers (eg ListenerQueue).

        Specified by:
        removeAllListeners in interface INotifySupport

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(EventListener listener)
        Removes the given listener from the list of selectableListeners.

        This will work even if the given listener is wrapped up in a listener wrapper such as a ListenerQueue.

        Specified by:
        removeListener in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        Returns:
        True if the listener was found.

      • fireNotify

        public List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event)
        Description copied from interface: INotifySupport
        Equivalent to fireNotify( event, 0 );
        Specified by:
        fireNotify in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.
        See Also:
        INotifySupport.fireNotify(EventObject, int )

      • fireNotify

        public List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event,
                                               int minListeners)
        Description copied from interface: INotifySupport
        Sends event to all listeners.

        If the event was sent to fewer than minListeners then that will be regarded as an error. In that case, a non null list will be returned containing an appropriate ListenerExceptionEntry.

        If a listener throws an exception when it is notified, that exception is returned in a List (because there may be more than one listener, we may need to return more than one Exception).
        If a listener's removeOnException attribute is true, then if that listener throws an exception it will automatically be removed.

        Specified by:
        fireNotify in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        minListeners - Minimum number of listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.

      • findMatchingListeners

        public List<ISelectableListenerEntry> findMatchingListeners(ISelectableListenerEntryPredicate predicate)
        Description copied from interface: ISelectableNotifySupport
        Return a list containing all listeners matching the specified predicate
        Specified by:
        findMatchingListeners in interface ISelectableNotifySupport
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate
        Returns:
        the matches. Empty if none found. Never null.

      • isSynchronizedNotifications

        public boolean isSynchronizedNotifications()
        Returns whether of not calls to fireNotify() are synchronized. If true only one thread at a time will be allowed to execute fireNotify(). If false concurrent calls are possible, in this case it is up to the listeners to implement thread safety.
        Returns:
        the value set via constructor or setSynchronizedNotifications()

      • setSynchronizedNotifications

        public void setSynchronizedNotifications(boolean value)
        Specify whether of not calls to fireNotify() are synchronized. If true only one thread at a time will be allowed to execute fireNotify(). If false concurrent calls are possible, in this case it is up to the listeners to implement thread safety.
        Parameters:
        value - whether of not calls to fireNotify() are synchronized
